column4: Anyone know why a routine update of linux-headers would prevent booting?
prevent booting do you mean no graphics in X?  maybe you were using propriatary drivers?
preventing booting: "error: cannot read the Linux header. error: you need to load the kernel first"
well if something is looking for headers sounds like it's trying to compile something?
!sacarlson Usually when dpkg runs I usually see updates to linux headers and it's usually no problem. But the latest update of those totally causes a boot fail
well hold the shift key at boot and try boot the older kernel I guess.
I may be forced to do that, right now I'm gonna try to reboot from a CD
I assume you still have the old kernel,  if that is still installed just change default back to that
yes, it's booting now, I'll try to roll back to the pre-update state, still wondering why that would happen when it hasn't before
you could also turn the text view on to see at what point it happens.  there's a gui called startup-manager that makes it easy to make changes in grub to change defaults and turn text on
I generally prefer grub to lilo
startup-manager is just the gui for grub2
I also have my /boot/grub/menu.lst backed up just in case anything gets overwritten
usually I just edit grub on the command line
I don't thing grub2 uses /boot/grub/menu.lst any more
yes that's true, guess I need to back up again! =)
